Key Match Events: Max O‚ÄôDowd anchored the Netherlands chase with a calm and composed half-century, carrying his bat as the Dutch survived a couple of nervy periods to reach 109/4 and win with seven balls to spare.
Netherlands bowlers were in good form with the ball in Dallas and bowled Nepal out for 106.
Logan van Beek wrapped the innings up to finish with 3/18 from 3.2.
Pre-Game Insights: The fans were out in force for the first match for Netherlands and Nepal at this T20 World Cup.
Both teams knew that victory in this game was likely to be crucial if they are to stand a chance of making it out of a group packed with quality.
Post-Match Reflections: Max ODowd's gritty 54* guides the Netherlands to a victory against Nepal in Dallas üëè#T20WorldCup | #NEDvNEP
Nepal will hope to bounce back when they line up next against Sri Lanka in Lauderhill on Wednesday 12 June.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A rain shower ensured that the toss was officially delayed by half an hour, prompting fears of a reduced-overs contest in front of a big crowd in Dallas.
Some excellent bowling in the powerplay kept things tight for the Dutch, who removed both openers cheaply.
And two further wickets fell as Nepal reached 53/4 at the midway point of their innings.
